content.description: The route goes up a right to left crack system (right of the wide Basilisk crack) and then straight up to the anchors.  Take care to protect where possible on the upper section.
content.protection: Basic trad rack with some larger pieces (about 3") for the bottom.
content.location: The route shares an anchor with Basilisk but it starts a bit downhill on an easy ramp.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Whomped Willow
climbs.fa: Steve Galloway, Mike Glover, Karl Kiser & Mark Grazier, Fall 2017

content.description: Balance up slabby face hold to a short bulge, grab a short horn and pull up, the crux, and finish on more face climbing.  One can TR an easier line a little to the left of the primary route.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.  Rap the route.
content.location: The route starts perhaps 30 feet right of Not Slytherin.

climbs.name: Wands At The Ready
climbs.fa: Karl Kiser, Mark Grazier, Cynthia Adams & Anna Brown, Spring 2017

content.description: The run is on the face in the middle of the climb.  There is a bit of a run between bolts 5 and 6 but the climbing is quite positive.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.
content.location: Walk uphill on the left side of the crag to a flat face climb.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: This Way to Platform 9 3/4
climbs.fa: Karl Kiser, Danielle Aronson & Mark Grazier, Summer 2017

content.description: Face climb straight up the slab.  There are a few harder moves above the second bolt which can be bypassed on the left for an easier climb.
content.protection: 4 bolts to a chains and bolt anchor.  Rap the route.
content.location: The climb is about 10 yards right of Cactus Butt starting on a clean slab.

content.description: Follow the weakness slightly right and then traverse left into Cactus Butt at about the second bolt.
content.protection: TR to the same anchor as Cactus Butt.
content.location: Start a few feet right of Cactus Butt.

climbs.name: Rattle Face
climbs.fa: Karl Kiser, Steve Galloway & Mark Grazier, Fall 2017

content.description: Simply climb the lower angle face, about 5.7 to the first anchor.  One can extend Rattle Face for another 25 feet by climbing to the Basilisk anchor (about 5.8).
content.protection: 6 bolts to a bolt and link anchor.  2 additional bolts to a higher anchor shared with Basilisk.  It is 9 clips for the entire longer route.
content.location: The climb goes straight up the face to the bolted anchor for Rattle Crack.

content.description: The hardest portion of the climb is where the crack goes left.  Historically the climb had a short second pitch.
content.protection: Trad gear to three inches.  There is a bolted anchor with links at the top.  Rap the route.
content.location: The route is in the center of the crag and follows a curving crack to the left.

content.description: Climb just right of I must Not Tell Lies, step left to the top of the column, and then continue up the nice face to the shared anchor
content.protection: TR to a bolt and chain anchor.  Rap the route.
content.location: Shares an anchor with I Must Not Tell Lies.

climbs.name: Not Slytherin
climbs.fa: Teresa Sedlacek, Mark Grazier, Karl Kiser & Anna Brown, Summer 2017

content.description: Face climb up to a short crack, pull the bulge on good holds (the crux) and continue up the easier upper face.
content.protection: 9 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.  Rap the route.
content.location: This is the longest route and starts at the toe of the rock. The climb is only a few feet right of Rattle Crack.

content.description: The TR joins Cactus Butt at about the third bolt.
content.protection: TR to the same anchor as Cactus Butt.
content.location: Start in the left to right crack left of Cactus Butt.

climbs.name: I Must Not Tell Lies
climbs.fa: Emile Sfakianos, Alex Sfakianos, Karl Kiser & Mark Grazier, Fall 2017

content.description: The crux is the entry to the upper crack.  The last half of the route is quite easy.
content.protection: 7 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.  Rap the route.
content.location: The route is just around the corner from Cactus Butt.

content.description: Climb the left to right crack just right of Bring Out Your Dead.
content.protection: TR off the same anchor as Bring Out Your Dead.

climbs.name: Grab Them By the Crookshanks
climbs.fa: Mark Starr, Karl Kiser & Mark Grazier, Fall 2017

content.description: The bolts are a little farther apart but the cruxes on the two smaller bulges are protected.  There are TRs off both sides of the top (left 5.9/5.10 and right 5.10/5.11).
content.protection: 4 bolts to a bolt and chain anchor.  Extend alpine draws for a TR.
content.location: The route goes up a small pillar about 50 feet left of the main wall.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Cactus Butt
climbs.fa: Steve Matsumoto, Mark Grazier & Karl Kiser, Spring 2017

content.description: The crux is steep climbing over two bolts to a good stance and more fun climbing to the top.  There are TR variations on both sides.  The left is about 5.8 and the right about 5.10+.
content.protection: 5 bolts to a chain and bolt anchor.
content.location: The route is just right of a substantial cactus patch.  Rap the route.

climbs.name: Bring Out Your Dead
climbs.fa: Mark Grazier, Danielle Aronson & Karl Kiser, Summer 2017

content.description: The route boasts fun movement on good rock.  The crux, at least two approaches, is above the second bolt.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a chain and bolt anchor.
content.location: The route is on the far right of the crag, perhaps 50 yards right of Cactus Butt.  Rap the route.

content.description: Climb up a large leaning flake and stay on the edge of a flat panel with stemming moves on the right of the large crack.  The crux is about a third of the way up the climb.
content.protection: Light rack including a couple of large pieces for the crack at the bottom (about purple Big Bro).  Climb to a bolt and chain anchor.  Rap the Route.  The anchor can also be accessed by a left traverse from the anchors of Not Slytherin.
content.location: The climb is 10 feet right of Wands at the Ready.

content.description: This area is a few hundred yards up the road from Luna Park on the east side of the road.  Historically there were at least two climbs:  Rattle Crack (trad crack) and Cactus Butt (TR).  Trees provide a shady belay stance on generally flat ground.
